## Developer Guide

If you are new to using `nbdev` here are some useful pointers to get you
started.

### Install upma in Development mode

``` sh
# make sure upma package is installed in development mode
$ pip install -e .

# make changes under nbs/ directory
# ...

# compile to have changes apply to upma
$ nbdev_prepare
```

## Usage

### Installation

Install latest from the GitHub
[repository](https://github.com/suchith720/upma):

``` sh
$ pip install git+https://github.com/suchith720/upma.git
```

or from [conda](https://anaconda.org/suchith720/upma)

``` sh
$ conda install -c suchith720 upma
```

or from [pypi](https://pypi.org/project/upma/)

``` sh
$ pip install upma
```

### Documentation

Documentation can be found hosted on this GitHub
[repository](https://github.com/suchith720/upma)’s
[pages](https://suchith720.github.io/upma/). Additionally you can find
package manager specific guidelines on
[conda](https://anaconda.org/suchith720/upma) and
[pypi](https://pypi.org/project/upma/) respectively.
